title.native: ゲッターロボ アーク

description:
The world is on the brink of apocalypse following an onslaught of invaders. To fight the attacking hoard, one of the original Getter Robo pilots, Hayato Jin, has finished Getter Arc, a new fighting unit based on the final work and ultimate masterpiece of Professor Saotome. Now the son of Ryouma – one of Hayato's copilots on the first-generation Getter – Takuma, the half-human half-Saurian Kamui, and Baku, younger brother of the extraordinary ESPer Tahir, step aboard the Getter Arc to combat the ruthless incursion and restore hope to their ravaged world!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Dinosaurs
tags.description: Prominently features Dinosaurs, prehistoric reptiles that went extinct millions of years ago.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

title.native: ゲッターロボ アーク

name.native: ロン・シュヴァイツァ博士

node.description:
Kiyoshi Nagai, better known by the pen name Gou Nagai, is a Japanese manga artist and a prolific author of science fiction, fantasy, horror and erotica. He made his professional debut in 1967 with Meakashi Polikichi, but is best known for creating popular 1970s manga and anime series such as [Cutie Honey](https://anilist.co/manga/86168/Cutey-Honey/), [Devilman](https://anilist.co/manga/31474/Devilman/) and [Mazinger Z](https://anilist.co/manga/38773/Mazinger-Z/). He is credited with creating the super robot genre and for designing the first mecha robots piloted by a user from within a cockpit with Mazinger Z, and for pioneering the magical girl genre with Cutie Honey, the post-apocalyptic genre with [Violence Jack](https://anilist.co/manga/31442/Violence-Jack/), and the ecchi genre with [Harenchi Gakuen](https://anilist.co/manga/42808/Harenchi-Gakuen/). 

In 2005, he became a Character Design professor at the Osaka University of Arts. He has been a member of the Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize's nominating committee since 2009.

Ken Ishikawa was a Japanese manga artist. He is renowned as the co-creator, with Go Nagai, of the Getter Robo anime series, as well as four of their subsequent manga continuations.    He collapsed at a dinner banquet, after a day of golf, and was rushed to the hospital where he was pronounced dead according to his mentor, [Go Nagai](https://anilist.co/staff/97992/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/川越淳)

Started off as an animator.

He is an animator and character designer. Motohashi started working at Studio Z. Later, after leaving Studio Z, he started together with Hirayama Satoshi and Kamegaki Hajime Studio Z5. Today he is affiliated with Xebec and is the representative director of its subsidiary Xebec M2.

JAM Project ("JAM" standing for "Japan Animationsong Makers") is an anime music genre (or anison) "supergroup" based in Japan, originally founded on July 19, 2000 by famous 1970s theme song artist Ichirou Mizuki. The group is composed of many vocal artists well known in the genre; aside from the many anime and video game theme songs that this group has performed together, each member is famous for their own solo performances of anime-related music.  As a group, they are perhaps best known for their themes for the Super Robot Wars series of video games.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/%E5%AF%BA%E7%94%B0%E5%BF%97%E4%BF%9D-%E5%85%AC-%E5%BC%8F-1611368459092936/) | [Website](http://shiho-terada.com/)

A Japanese composer, arranger and keyboard player. She graduated from the Kunitachi College of Music.
Yoshichika Kuriyama is a composer, arranger and synthesizer programmer.
Yoshinaga Minami is an animation producer.
Toshiyuki Horii is a mechanical designer.
Toshiyuki Horii is a mechanical designer.
